channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-16725] Don't let flushThread hang in TestHRegion
item.description:
I was running TestHRegion locally and observed the following in test output:


2016-09-28 16:29:36,836 INFO  [main] hbase.ResourceChecker(171): after: regionserver.TestHRegion#testFlushCacheWhileScanning Thread=50 (was 49)

Potentially hanging thread: FlushThread

  java.lang.Object.wait(Native Method)

  java.lang.Object.wait(Object.java:502)

  org.apache.hadoop.hbase.regionserver.TestHRegion$FlushThread.run(TestHRegion.java:3834)

Call to flushThread.done() etc should be placed in the finally block.
item.summary: Don't let flushThread hang in TestHRegion

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
Maybe put other thread joins also in finally? 

      putThread.join();

      putThread.checkNoError();

Also, we should check for interrupted exception from join() otherwise we'll fail to close region and wal.

As a side question, how accurate are "potentially hanging thread" notifications? stack your thoughts please.

-1 overall

The potentially hanging thread is real helpful. Sometimes it is just a lagging thread but no danger of zombies if no hanging thread at end of a test run.

I don't see how the failures are related given a patch for a test. Are the failing tests subclassing or reusing this part of TestHRegion?

The following tests extend HRegion which passed in the QA run:
